org.magnos.net
Interface Protocol<D>

Type Parameters:
D - The data encoded and decoded.
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractProtocol
public interface Protocol<D>

A protocol decodes an object from a ByteReader and encodes an object to a ByteWriter.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Method Summary
 D decode(org.magnos.io.bytes.ByteReader in, Client client)

          Encodes an object of type D to the given ByteWriter.

          Returns the listener to this protocol.

          Returns the data type of the protocol.

          Sets the listener to this protocol.
 

Method Detail

getType

java.lang.Class<D> getType()
Returns the data type of the protocol.

Returns:
The class of the data.

decode

D decode(org.magnos.io.bytes.ByteReader in,
         Client client)
Attempts to decode an object of type D from the given ByteReader. If there is not enough data in the ByteReader null should be returned. If an object has been successfully decoded the ByteReader should be synced to avoid receiving the same message indefinitely. For example: 
 D result = new D();
 // ... invokes various get methods of in
 if (in.isValid()) {
     in.sync();
     return result;
 }
 return null;
If the input is indecodable by this protocol the appropriate methods should be invoked to the client (maybe change the protocol or close it).

Parameters:
in - The reader to use to decode the object.
client - The client which is decoding objects from its input.
Returns:
The object decoded or null if an object could

encode

void encode(org.magnos.io.bytes.ByteWriter out,
            D data,
            Client client)
Encodes an object of type D to the given ByteWriter. Once the data is written the protocol does not have to invoke the flush method, that will be handled by the server/client encoding the object.

Parameters:
out - The writer to use to encode the object.
data - The object to encode.
client - The client which is encoding data to its output.

getListener

ProtocolListener<D> getListener()
Returns the listener to this protocol.

Returns:
The reference to the listener of this protocol.

setListener

void setListener(ProtocolListener<D> listener)
Sets the listener to this protocol.

Parameters:
listener - The new listener to this protocol.
